definition: to deliver/to carry/to give (as a present)/to present (with)/to see off/to send
to leave/to depart/to separate/to distinguish/to classify/other/another/don't ...!/to pin/to stick (sth) in
to make sb change their ways, opinions etc

sentences.english: A farewell in Leningrad, in the spring of 1942.
sentences.chinese: 1942年春天，在列宁格勒的一场送别仪式。

sentences.english: Ann used to stand at the window and wave goodbye.
sentences.chinese: 安总是要站在窗前挥手送别。

sentences.english: And the cash registers in Lauscha keep ringing out.
sentences.chinese: 并且能听到劳沙的现金登记员在不停地送别游客。

sentences.english: The contents of both Su's and Xin's were profound and abundant.
sentences.chinese: 苏轼与辛弃疾的送别词内容丰富，气象万千。

sentences.english: The same is true with thr activity of seeing off a foreign guest.
sentences.chinese: 这同你要送别一个国外客户的情况是一样的。

sentences.english: When inquiring after a man in a foreign land, he would prostrate himself twice on seeing the message off.
sentences.chinese: 托人向国外的朋友致礼问好，他总是再次拜谢后送别。

sentences.english: We nearly all chipped in to buy Jennifer a trialing-out of present.
sentences.chinese: 我们大家都凑了钱买一个送别礼物给詹妮弗。

sentences.english: Ann always to stand at the window and waves to see off .
sentences.chinese: 安总要站在窗口前并挥手送别。

sentences.english: If he'd played in that match he would have got a great send-off and it all would have been fine.
sentences.chinese: 如果他踢了那场比赛一切都会没事，我们会为他送别。

sentences.english: We 'sl of chipped in to buy Jennifer a spining-away present.
sentences.chinese: 我们大师都凑了钱买一个送别礼物给詹妮弗。

sentences.english: We all chipped in to buy Jennifer a going-away present.
sentences.chinese: 我们大家都凑了钱买一个送别礼物给詹妮弗。
你不送给玛利亚一份送别礼物吗？

sentences.english: Need we take a farewell party for him?
sentences.chinese: 我们需要为他举办一个送别晚晏吗？

sentences.english: We all chipped in to buy Jennifer a going-away present.
sentences.chinese: 大家都凑了钱买送别礼物给詹妮弗。

sentences.english: We everything chipped in to buy Jennifer a spining-on holiday present.
sentences.chinese: 我们公共都凑了钱买一个送别礼物给詹妮弗。

definition: to see someone off/to throw someone a send-off party
to leave (on a long journey)/to part from sb
to bid farewell/to part (usually with little hope of meeting again)
to mourn/to pay last respects/mourning/memorial (service etc)
